newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada's Prairies to see snow west, showers east.
newsitem.headline: Canada's Prairies to see snow west, showers east.

text.p: Canada's Prairies were forecast Tuesday to see snow in the west and showers in the east, Environment Canada said.
Alberta should see snow in the northeast and highs of -4 Celsius in the north and +6 Celsius in the south.
Saskatchewan should see scattered snow flurries or showers with highs of -5 Celsius to +6 Celsius, north to south.
Manitoba should see increasing cloudiness with scattered showers and highs of -2 Celsius to +10 Celsius.
Seeding of cereal and oilseed crops usually becomes general in a month's time.
Normal highs for the Prairies at this time is +3 Celsius.
